titles.title: Carry-On Baggage Reduction Act of 1997

To direct the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration to issue regulations to limit the number of pieces of carry-on baggage that a passenger may bring on an airplane to 1 piece of carry-on baggage per passenger.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Aviation.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

bill.summary: 11/13/1997--Introduced. Carry-On Baggage Reduction Act of 1997 - Directs the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration to modify specified regulations to require air carrier certificate holders to limit each air passenger to one piece of carry-on baggage when boarding an airplane.
